page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {CANNINGS GRAVE At junction of three parishes of Bathford, Batheaston and Colerne. Also close to 3 shires stone.Possibly connected with Cannards Grave near Shepton Mallet.Coincidental in{four ways:- {1.Similar Names}-possibly derived from names of 2 Wessex kings - Cenned & Centwine.Grave derived from Saxon word graef meaning grove. 2.Both stand on the{Fosse Way. 3.Both stand on the borders of{three parishes. 4.Both were{trading sites. Cannings Grave may have been hunting seat of king Centwine. {GEORGE INN - BATHAMPTON Possibly 14th century.A hostelry for monks of ancient priory of{Hampton. Very popular today. Lovely situation on banks of{Kennet & Avon Canal.
